name: Black Monday hits the Oil Wells
description: Dios Mio! With the majority of our foreign trade being with Germany, it was inevitable that their economic crisis would reach us. For now, we must deal with the immediate consequences as panic spreads amongst the people of Caracas.

name: Democracy Prevails
description: Calm has returned in cities across Venezuela. Now, we can properly focus on the path to economic recovery, especially as the workers have been hit quite hard by the ongoing crisis.

name: Welfare Programs
description: It would be a mistake to cut welfare when the people needs it the most. In fact, we must ensure that our welfare programs can reach as many Venezuelans as possible while they are vulnerable.

name: Expand Healthcare and Education
description: Healthcare and education are the most basic and necessary institutions provided by the state and we must ensure that they are able to reach the people. Ensuring that our people remains healthy and educated is the best thing we can do for future generations, for the long-term benefits are obvious even in these trying times.

name: Expand Pensions
description: The people that are unable to work, such as seniors and disabled, are the most vulnerable during disasters. Thus, in order to maintain stability and keep people happy, we should expand the pensions system so that more poor Venezuelans can access it.

name: Industrial Investments
description: As a key step in both recovering from the crisis and reducing our dependence on the oil industry, the state needs to invest in different industrial sectors, ensuring their growth and ability to employ more people.

name: Economic Flexibility
description: The current crisis has shown that we cannot remain dependent on the petroleum industry. As such, we must make our economy more flexible and able to adapt to the changing global economy by diversifying it. This will, hopefully, make our economy stronger and more resilient to economic fluctuations.

name: Industrial Diversification
description: Diversifying our industry is a costly and slow process, but will ensure that the Venezuelan economy can continue to grow at a healthy rate safe from market fluctuations. Despite the cost and speed of such a process, it will make Venezuela far stronger in the long run than continuing our dependence on oil.

name: Preventive Coup
description: With the AD government unable to maintain order, the Venezuelan Army has stepped in to restore order and guide the economy towards recovery. This is temporary, of course, as the Provisional Government insists that the scheduled elections in 1939 will still happen.

name: Defence Contracts
description: As a way to help the economy, the government is issuing more contracts to supply the military with goods. This will help our struggling, small manufacturing sector recover and grow, thus employing and enriching more Venezuelans while ensuring that the Armed Forces remain well-equipped and influential.

name: Weapons Industry Expansion
description: Venezuela's military industry is, frankly, tiny. Especially compared to the size of its military. Demand for military goods such as arms and ammunition may be artificial, but it keeps people working, paid, and buying. Besides, keeping the army well-equipped will help avoid repeating their poor showing in 1925.

name: Army Goods Self Sufficiency
description: The less dependent we are on arms imports the better. Especially as the global situation continue to spiral out of control. Since we may not be able to continue importing, we may as well expand our local military industry and substitute imports.

name: Welfare Cuts
description: With the economy in shambles, we must tighten our belt and reduce spending. The welfare programs enacted by the preceding government are a heavy burden on our shaky finances, putting us into debt. The programs should be terminated to balance the budget.

name: Arrest Syndicalist Troublemakers
description: The dangers of a potential syndicalist revolution are the reasons why the military stepped in after Black Monday. With the Provisional Government secured, we have the ability to arrest key members of the syndicalist movement in Venezuela and weaken their influence in politics.

name: Propaganda Efforts
description: While our coup was not without precedent, it did make the political opposition, especially those formerly in government beforehand, are wary about the erosion of democratic institutions. We must ensure that the people understand the temporary character of our government and that the scheduled elections are maintained.

name: Emergency Infrastructure Works
description: As a temporary measure to put people back to work, the government has begun a program of infrastructure work. This will not only give paid work for the workless, but will also improve the infrastructure network of Venezuela, bringing the country closer together.

name: Airport Construction Effort
description: Air transport has become more widespread since the Weltkrieg. However, our air infrastructure is severely lacking, and improving it would aid in the development of our Air Force and improve access to more isolated parts of our country.

name: Infrastructure Renewal
description: While the economy is definitely recovering, there is still much more we can do to improve the transport network of our nation. After all, good infrastructure is key to healthy economic development.

name: Economic Recovery
description: Venezuela has finally recovered from the economic crisis. While there is still much more to be done to make the country prosperous again, we are definitely past the worst of the crisis. We can now focus our attention towards growing our economy and create a prosperous Venezuela.

name: 1939 Election
description: Despite the economic crisis, the scheduled election will still be held. The Acción Democrática will attempt to win a new term, but the Unión Republicana Democrática has a good chance of taking over, focusing on economic prosperity and nationalist rhetoric. However, the syndicalist PSV has been growing since Black Monday, and have a small chance at a surprise victory with their anti-capitalist rhetoric.

name: Another AD Term
description: With little surprise, the party representing the Generación del 26 has won another presidential term. They intend to continue transforming Venezuela into a welfare state less dependent on the petroleum industry.

name: Long-Term Economic Planning
description: If we are to have a successful, prosperous economy, we must focus on long-term economic goals rather than short-term ones. This will create a healthy and stable economy rather than a bubble that will inevitably burst.

name: Reduce Our Dependency on Oil
description: It is no secret that, despite our efforts for the past decade, Venezuela is addicted to black gold. Now that we have successfully secured our mandate, we can focus on diversifying our economy even further and reduce our dependence on the oil industry as much as possible to ensure sustainable growth.

name: Safety from Market Fluctuations
description: Black Monday has shown that our economy is vulnerable to market fluctuations. With our experience and diverse economy, we should be able to respond quicker and more effectively should another crisis hit us.

name: Protecting Workers
description: Protecting Venezuela's workers is a top priority for a social-democratic government. More legislation is being pushed through Congress for better workplace safety regulations and improving the social safety net for the poor.

name: Public Investments
description: Improving public institutions such as schools, hospitals and parks are all imperative for the government, ensuring that quality of life is improved throughout the nation.

name: Towards a Welfare State
description: Striving for a welfare state is an ambitious and lofty goal, but as our economy grows and our welfare programs get more funding, our nation is slowly progressing towards it, making us one of the most developed countries in Latin America.

name: Healthy Economic Growth
description: The economy of Venezuela is growing at a steady and healthy pace. While our economy is not booming, we know that this is the most sensible way to develop our country without putting future generations in jeopardy. We can only hope that future Venezuelans will have great opportunities regardless of their social class and that, one day, socialism will be achieved peacefully.

name: URD Presidency
description: The Unión Republicana Democrática, consisting of moderate progressives, liberals and nationalists of the Generación del 26, have managed to take the presidency. We are on our way towards unimaginable economic prosperity, putting Venezuelans first and foremost.

name: Oil Industry Reforms
description: While large parts of the oil industry is in the hands of foreign companies, their home countries are focused on their own problems. Now is a good time to push for reforms in the industry, ensuring that Venezuelans get their rightful share of the profits and investments.

name: Oil Expansion
description: With the world growing tense and Venezuela watching from the sidelines, we cannot let such an opportunity go to waste. The petroleum industry must be expanded in order to satisfy the world's growing need for oil.

name: Oil Profit Investment
description: We must carefully invest the growing profits from the oil industry in order to ensure continued prosperity for Venezuelans.

name: Class Collaboration
description: Venezuelans, regardless of their social class, are one nation. We cannot let socialist demagogues foster artificial divisions in our society and, instead, foster a sense of national unity among the people regardless if they are rich or poor.

name: ¡Por pan, tierra y libertad!
description: For bread, fatherland and liberty! Fostering greater unity in Venezuela is essential for a stable and harmonious society. The URD's motto symbolises its commitment to prosperity, nationalism and liberty, making it a great slogan to rally around.

name: Dios y Federación
description: God and Federation is Venezuela's traditional motto since the Federal War of 1859-1863, which had a great impact in the country's institutional development and commitment to federalism and liberty. Fostering national pride is essential to create a united society.

name: Economic Boom
description: The economy is growing faster than ever! Taking advantage of the oil industry and wisely investing its great profits have led us to unprecedented growth that will lead to a prosperous, rich Venezuela.

name: Industrialisation
description: Venezuela's industry is small and fragile. Since industry is the basis for a modern economy, we must ensure that our nation can industrialise and prosper in the hope of creating a modern state comparable to our European and North American counterparts.

name: Naval Construction Investments
description: The naval industry in Venezuela is fairly small. However, it has potential to become something bigger if we invest more into it. After all, our growing navy needs better facilities and such a modern industry has many benefits from employing many Venezuelans, improving maritime trade and creating more goods to export.

name: Expanding the UCV
description: The Universidad Central de Venezuela, or Central University of Venezuela, is the country's top centre for higher education and research and one of the oldest on the Western Hemisphere. With more and more people being able to attend it, it would be wise to expand it, increasing its capacity and abilities.

name: Revolution by Ballot
description: The PSV's surprise electoral victory makes it one of the few examples of a syndicalist party gaining power through bourgeois means. Now, we can begin the Venezuelan Revolution and turn our nation into a model Socialist State in Latin America.

name: Empower the CTV
description: Trade unions are the centre of any syndicalist country. As such, we must empower the Confederación de Trabajadores de Venezuela, the country's primary labour union federation, so that the government can truly be in the hands of the workers, slowly dismantling the bourgeois state.

name: Workplace Democratisation
description: Venezuela's industry must be completely overhauled so that the means of production can be in the hands of the workers that labour so hard everyday. Workplace democracy is a necessity in order to truly free the workers, making them in charge of their own work.

name: Socialist Education
description: We can learn a lot from our friends in the Internationale. Overhauling Venezuela's education and institutions will create new generations of young socialists eager to work for the country's, and the world's, future.

name: Industry Nationalisation
description: We cannot allow the business class, foreign and local, to control our industry and economy. Nationalising them will allow us to implement our policies and ensure that the workers are free from exploitation and the bourgeoisie.

name: Land Reform
description: While Venezuela's land distribution is far from the worst case in Latin America, there are still many regions where landlords control the land and have far too much power and influence, exploiting poor farmers. As such, we must redistribute the land properly amongst peasants and free them from oppression.

name: Collectivisation
description: While not entirely popular among peasants, collectivisation will ensure that food is properly redistributed amongst the people. In addition, we will be able to coordinate collectives and ensure that they remain productive and efficient.

name: Oil Industry Nationalisation
description: The oil industry is a symbol of bourgeois oppression and inequality. As foreign companies and local capitalists control it, little of its incredible wealth ever reaches the workers. As such, and while the world is distracted, we should seize the foreign companies and nationalise the industry, ensuring that its wealth goes to the people.

name: Five Year Plan
description: Creating a socialist state in a less developed state is difficult, for a strong working class is the basis for it. Taking into account advice from the totalist faction, we have created a Five Year Plan to industrialise Venezuela to a level where Socialism will be possible.

name: Rapid Industrialisation
description: As a result of our Five Year Plan, Venezuela has been industrialising at an unimaginable pace. Soon, we will have a strong, free working class and a highly-developed industry matching our brothers in the Internationale such as France and Britain.

name: To Socialism!
description: ¡Proletarios de todos los países, uníos! Socialism is the true goal of the PSV. The revolution has only just begun, but soon, the workers of the world will be free and a classless society will be created.

name: Pérez Jiménez Seizes Power
description: With support from the USA, the army has stepped in to prevent a Syndicalist revolution, forming a military government under Marcos Pérez Jiménez. The strongman himself is staunchly anti-syndicalist and is already moving to purge leftist and dissenting elements in Venezuela for good.

name: Seguridad Nacional
description: The Dirección de Seguridad Nacional, or Directorate of National Security, has been created by Pérez Jiménez, transforming the previous Cuerpo de Investigación Nacional (National Investigation Corps) into a proper secret police able to root out the new government's dangerous opposition.

name: Threaten the Opposition
description: The opposition parties have been critical of our government, believing our coup to be illegal and particularly criticising the DSN as repressive. It is time to silence these dissenting Syndicalist sympathisers and... convince them to support our junta or face severe consequences.

name: Censorship
description: Our government is, legally, on shaky foundations. However, propaganda is a powerful tool. As long as the people support us, it doesn't matter how undemocratic our opponents claim we are. Of course, this means tightening the noose around the press and ensure than anti-junta propaganda cannot be spread.

name: New Treaty with the USA
description: It is no secret that the USA are our most important ally and trade partner. After all, without them, Venezuela would be in ruins due to the Syndicalists. It is only natural that we improve relations with them and we should sign a new mutually-beneficial treaty.

name: US Oil Companies
description: American oil companies have far more capital and experience than local ones. They will be able to improve the petroleum industry in Venezuela far more than we could on our own and more efficiently.

name: Oil Money Investment
description: The Junta is profiting immensely from the improved petroleum industry. A wise move would be to re-invest these profits into the economy or public projects, improving the government's image as a successful one.

name: Foreign Investors
description: With the US as close allies, we are well-aware of the benefits investors can bring into the country. As such, we must encourage them to invest into our country over others, helping us rebuild Venezuela to our image.

name: Infrastructure Development
description: Our president as an eye for opulence. He believes that massive infrastructure projects will improve the country's image within and without Venezuela as a modern and, more importantly, powerful nation.

name: Foreign Experts
description: In order to strengthen the country, education must be improved. One problem we face is that many Venezuelan intellectuals have fled during the coup. However, many foreign experts are eager to work for us and our goals, and we will need them to build Venezuela's future.

name: A Strong Venezuela
description: President Pérez Jiménez dreams of a strong Venezuela. One powerful enough to be a regional power in Latin America. As time goes on, we move closer and closer to achieving his goals. Soon, Venezuela will be South America's most powerful nation thanks to our great efforts.

name: Maintaining the Edge
description: Since the mid-1920s, successive governments have expanded the Venezuelan Army into the powerful force it is today. However, we absolutely cannot sit on our laurels, for we could easily lose our edge. Keeping the army modern will ensure that it remains a force to be reckoned with in the region.

name: Import New Arms
description: Venezuela has limited arms producing capabilities. Thankfully, several companies, such as FN in Wallonia and Steyr in Austria, have been eager to equip our forces at a nice price. We should contact them once more to top off our arsenals and ensure a sizeable reserve if the time comes.

name: Import Heavy Equipment
description: Heavy equipment such as artillery pieces are even more difficult to acquire in large numbers and they are absolutely necessary in modern warfare. Once more, we are reliant on arms imports until we can set up local production.

name: Local Arms Production
description: Our dependence on arms imports will inevitably become a problem if we end up at war again, potentially cut off from our external trade. We should hire foreign experts to set up local production, starting with the tools needed to repair and maintain our current arms before, hopefully, having enough experience to make our own.

name: Expand Local Production
description: Now that we have the basis of a domestic arms industry, we must invest in it further in order to substitute imports as much as possible. While we may never be able to match the great arsenals of Europe or the USA, we can certainly reduce our dependence on them and be more independent.

name: Doctrine Reevaluation
description: While much has been done since the humiliation of 1925, our doctrine is lagging behind the latest developments. As military technology and doctrine has changed dramatically in recent only a couple of decades, we must concentrate our efforts in ensuring that our officers are capable in waging a modern war.

name: Maximum Firepower
description: The key to warfare is ensuring that our forces have a firepower advantage over the enemy. This has been the truth for centuries now and the Europeans' experience in the Weltkrieg and the rest of the world since has only confirmed this.

name: Modern Fire Support
description: Fire support is key to limiting our casualties and maximising the enemy's. The key is the ensure that our officers and artillery gunners are able to coordinate with the infantry and vice-versa, and today's warfare has several ways to maximise this through training and improved communications.

name: Modern Artillery
description: Of course, fire support is incomplete without the artillery pieces themselves. Our artillery must be equipped with modern guns and manned by trained experts in order to maximise their firepower and efficiency. After all, modern guns are perhaps the deadliest force on the battlefield.

name: Shock and Awe
description: The idea of Shock and Awe consists of paralysing the foe with the spectacular use of overwhelming firepower, giving our troops the opportunity they need to repel an attack or create a breakthrough. This will require highly trained artillerymen and high coordination between supporting elements and the infantry.

name: Maximum Speed
description: The key to warfare is ensuring an advantage in mobility over the enemy, attacking them where they least expect it or where they are the weakest. Recent wars have shown that our forces must maintain momentum or else warfare degenerates into bloody static warfare.

name: Mass Motorisation
description: The best way to remain mobile in modern war is to ensure that an army has enough trucks to transport troops and supplies to the front line. A motorised army will be able to outmanoeuvre any foe stuck on foot or one being supplied by horse-drawn wagons.

name: Armoured Warfare
description: Tanks are a relatively new piece of military technology with fairly limited field experience. However, many believe that they are the future of warfare, the new cavalry with high mobility and firepower.

name: Modern Manoeuvre Warfare
description: Mobile warfare is certainly not a new concept as it dominated military thought until the Weltkrieg. New technological developments have made it relevant once more and Venezuela has wholeheartedly embraced it, making the Venezuelan Army one of the most modern forces on the continent.

name: Expand the AMV
description: The Academia Militar de Venezuela, or Military Academy of Venezuela, is the nation's top centre for military education and research. With how much the Army has grown in the past decade, it is about time that we invest in the AMV's expansion, ensuring that we have a competent officer corps and skilled experts in our military.

name: Jungle Warfare Training
description: The thick jungles in the south and east of Venezuela present an interesting challenge for our armed forces. Providing additional training for our troops will allow us to fight more effectively in these rough regions, which may prove decisive if we are to reclaim Guayana Esequiba.

name: Air Force Expansion
description: As the most junior branch of the armed forces, the air force has received considerably less attention than the army and navy. Since we are severely lagging behind in air power and theory, we should begin expanding the air force, for the potential of air power is too great to ignore.

name: Air Superiority
description: Part of the air force command supports a more independent air force, claiming that it can do far more than simply support the land forces. They want the air force to be an offensive tool, focusing on gaining air superiority over our and our foes' skies and using bombers to destroy their forces and morale.

name: Army Support
description: The more conservative officers in the air force, supported by army officers, believe that the air force is essentially an extention of the army and that it should focus on keeping enemy planes away from the army and supporting land operations.

name: Surplus Fighters
description: Our capacity for aircraft construction is practically non-existent. However, we can purchase fighter planes from the more developed nations to help us fill our aircraft needs for the time being.

name: Study Foreign Designs
description: Since we have a number of foreign aircraft designs in our inventory, we should study them thoroughly, which will help our own engineers improve in the field of aeronautics. Hopefully, this will help us start our own aviation industry.

name: Local Air Production
description: Now that we have a decent number of foreign aircrafts in service and good experience using and maintaining them, we are able to start producing military planes of our own. This is hopefully the birth of a great aircraft manufacturing industry.

name: Domestic Fighter Design
description: With talented engineers being hired by local aircraft producers, we can begin the ambitious project of designing a fighter aircraft of our own. This completely native design should allow us to independently develop our own air force while limiting imports.

name: Local Bomber Design
description: Bomber aircrafts have proven to be versatile in modern war. Producing one locally has many advantages, even if it is a costly endeavour, reducing our dependence on foreign arms imports and stimulating the military industry.

name: Venezuelan Naval Bomber
description: Considering the long coastline Venezuela has, a naval bomber is essential to defend our country. Making one of our own will be an interesting endeavour, but hopefully one that our nascent aviation industry can handle.

name: Continue Naval Expansion
description: With the humiliation against the failing British Empire in 1925, Venezuela has spent a significant amount of resources on its navy. With the world on its way to another great crisis, we will likely need to expand it even more to protect our independence and interests.

name: Venezuelan Dockyards
description: The Venezuelan naval industry is growing, but still fairly small considering the size of our navy. We will need to expand our docks if we are going to expand further, since our ships require maintenance and ambitious officers are eager to push for a domestic shipbuilding plan to help its expansion and stimulate the economy.

name: Fleet in Being
description: Our naval staff believes that if Venezuela has a large and powerful enough fleet, even the great powers of the world will think twice before trying to bully us and the other nations in the region will cower to our might.

name: Flexible Fleet
description: Let us not fall for over ambitious, unrealistic ideas for some kind of Grand Fleet. Younger officers in the fleet believe that the navy should focus on a flexible fleet able to fight our enemies indirectly through submarine warfare and raiders while protecting our shipping lanes.

name: Coastal Defence Ships
description: Venezuela, even with its oil money, cannot possibly afford the large capital ships the major powers can. As such, the idea of smaller capital ships with limited range, but high armour and firepower designed to protect the coasts has been wholeheartedly embraced by the naval staff.

name: Modern Cruisers
description: Cruisers are essential for scouting and long-range operations. Considering that our shipping needs to be protected in wartime, modern cruisers are something our navy cannot skip on.

name: New Destroyers
description: Destroyers are the main vessels designed to screen the larger ships of our navy. Their versatility, a necessity in order to fight off smaller crafts, and powerful torpedo armament, the small ships are just as important as the capital ships of the fleet.

name: Modern Submarines
description: Submarines are a relatively new addition to the navies around the world, but their utility and potential has already been proven in the Weltkrieg. Thanks to their relative cost-efficiency, they are a perfect way for Venezuela to bolster its naval power.

name: Navegare necesse, viviere non necesse
description: \"Navigating is Necessary, Living is not\" While Venezuela never had a large fleet, it has strong traditions going back to the country's founding, and is now a modern fighting force to be reckoned with. It's sailors and officers are highly trained and disciplined, ready to protect the nation like their predecessors did.
